source.title: Wyoming dinosaur 'mummies' reveal a surprise: Hoofed feet - NBC News
source.name: NBC News

facts: Two fossilized 'mummies' of the duckbilled dinosaur Edmontosaurus were found in Wyoming.
The mummified remains provided exquisite detail about external anatomy.
'Mummies' refers to exceptionally preserved specimens, not actual human-like burial practices.
Edmontosaurus is a type of duckbilled dinosaur known as Hadrosaurid.
The discovery included surprising evidence: hooves on the feet.

neutral.headline: Wyoming Dinosaur 'Mummies' Reveal Duckbill with Hoofed Feet
neutral.body_html: Two fossilized remains of a duckbilled dinosaur, Edmontosaurus, unearthed in Wyoming have provided scientists an exquisite look at its external features. The findings include the surprising presence of hooves on their feet.

conservative.headline: Wyoming Dinosaur 'Mummies' Reveal Duckbill with Hooved Feet
conservative.body_html: Two fossilized remains of a duckbilled dinosaur, Edmontosaurus, unearthed in Wyoming have provided scientists an exquisite look at its external features. The findings include the surprising presence of hooves on their feet.

liberal.headline: 'Mummies' Reveal Duckbilled Dinosaur with Hooved Feet, Challenging Previous Beliefs
liberal.body_html: Two fossilized remains of a duckbilled dinosaur, Edmontosaurus, unearthed in Wyoming have provided scientists an exquisite look at its external features. The findings include the surprising presence of hooves on their feetâ€”a discovery that challenges previous beliefs about this species and offers new insights into prehistoric life.
